title: Lalitā Sahasranāmam (1000 Names of the Divine Mother Lalitā)
author: Attributed to the Vāgdevatās (Goddesses of Speech)
recension: Standard Dhyāna Bhāga & Mūla Pāṭha (First Section)

chapters.name: Pūrva Bhāga (Dhyāna) and First 10 Names
chapters.summary: This section contains the preliminary verses for meditation (Dhyāna Ślokas) and the first ten of the 1000 names of the Goddess, beginning with Śrī Mātā.

verses.original:
अरुणां करुणा तरङ्गित अक्षीं धृत पाशाङ्कुश पुष्प बाणचापाम्।
अणिमादिभिर् आवृतां मयूखैर् अहम् इत्येव विभावये भवानीम्॥
verses.transliteration: Arunam karuna tarangithakshim Dhruta paashankusha pushpabana chapam Animadi bhiravrutam mayukhaihi ahamithyeva vibhavaye, bhavaneem

translations.english: I contemplate upon Bhavānī (Lalita) as the Self (Aham-Iti), whose complexion is dawn-red, whose eyes are filled with waves of compassion, who holds the noose, the goad, the flowery arrows, and the bow, and who is surrounded by rays emanating from the eight Siddhis (Aṇimā, etc.).

verses.original:
श्रीम॑ता श्री॑महा-राज्ञी श्री॑मत्-सिंहा॑सने-श्वरी ।
चिद॑ग्नि कुण्ड॑-संभूता॑ देव-कार्य॑ समुद्यता॑ ॥ १॥
verses.transliteration: Sree-mata shree maha-ragyni shreemat sinhasaneshvaree Chidagni kunda-sanbhuta deva-karya samudyata

translations.english: The **Holy Mother** (Śrī Mātā), the **Great Empress** (Śrī Mahārājñī), the **Queen of the Auspicious Throne** (Śrīmat-Siṃhāsaneśvarī). **Born from the Fire-pit of Consciousness** (Cidagni-kuṇḍa-sambhūtā), and **Ready to fulfill the purpose of the Devas** (Devakārya-samudyatā).

verses.original:
उद्य॑द्-भानु॑ सहस्र-आभा॑ चतुर्-बाहु॑ समन्वि-ता ।
राग॑-स्वरूप॑ पाश-आढ्या॑ क्रोधा-कार॑-अङ्कुश-उज्ज्वला॑ ॥ २॥
verses.transliteration: Udyadbanu saha-srabha chatur-bahu saman-vita Raga-svarupa pashadya krodha-karanku-shojvala

translations.english: She whose **splendor is like a thousand rising Suns** (Udyad-bhānu-sahasrābhā), who is **endowed with four arms** (Caturbāhu-samanvitā). She **holds the noose that is the form of Love/Attachment** (Rāga-svarūpa-pāśāḍhyā), and **shines with the goad that is the form of Anger/Aversion** (Krodhākārāṅkuśojjvalā).

verses.original:
मनो॑-रूप॑-इक्षु कोदण्डा॑ पञ्च तन्मा॑त्र सायका॑ ।
निज॑-अरुण॑ प्रभा-पूर॑ मज्जत्-ब्रह्मा॑ण्ड मण्डला॑ ॥ ३॥
verses.transliteration: Mano-rupekshu kodanda pancha tanmatra sayaka Nijaruna prabha-pura majabhramhanda mandala

translations.english: She whose **bow is the form of the mind** (Manorūpekṣu-kodaṇḍā), and whose **arrows are the five subtle elements** (Pañcatanmātra-sāyakā). The entire **universe is immersed in the flood of Her own red splendor** (Nijāruṇa-prabhāpūra-majjad-brahmāṇḍa-maṇḍalā).

verses.original:
चम्प॑क-अशोक॑ पुंनाग॑ सौगन्धि॑क लसत्-कचा॑ ।
कुरुवि॑न्द मणि॑-श्रेणी॑ कण्ठ-कोटि॑र मण्डिता॑ ॥ ४॥
verses.transliteration: Chanpaka shoka punnaga saogandhika lasatkacha Kuruvinda mani shrenee kanatkotira mandita

translations.english: She whose **hair shines with the fragrance of Campaka, Aśoka, and Punnāga flowers** (Campakāśoka-punnāga-saugandhika-lasatkacā). She is **adorned with a shining crown made of rows of Kuruvinda gems** (Kuruvinda-maṇi-śreṇī-kaṇat-koṭīra-maṇḍitā).

verses.original:
अष्ट॑मी च॑न्द्र विभ्राज॑द्-अलि॑क-स्थल शोभिता॑ ।
मुख-च॑न्द्र कलङ्क-आभा॑ मृग-नाभि॑ विशेषका॑ ॥ ५॥
verses.transliteration: Ashtami chandra vibhraja dalikasdhala shobhita Mukha-chandra kalankabha mruga-nabhi visheshaka

translations.english: She **shines with a forehead adorned like the brilliant crescent of the eighth-day moon** (Aṣṭamī-candra-vibhrājad-alika-sthala-śobhitā). She wears a **musk-tilaka (Visheshaka) that resembles the dark spot (kalanka) on the moon-like face** (Mukha-candra-kalaṅkābhā-mṛga-nābhi-viśeṣakā).

verses.original:
वद॑न-स्म॑र माङ्गल्य॑ गृह-तोर॑ण चिल्लि॑का ।
वक्त्र॑-लक्ष्मी॑ परि-वाह॑-चलन्-मीन॑-आभ लोच॑ना ॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration: Vadanas-mara mangalya gruhatorana chillika Vaktra-lakshmi pari-vaha chalan-minabha lochana

translations.english: Her **eyebrows are like the festoons (Torana) over the auspicious gate of the house of Kandarpa** (the God of Love) that is Her face (Vadana-smara-māṅgalya-gṛha-toraṇa-cillikā). Her **eyes resemble moving fish** (Calan-mīnābhā-locanā), **streaming from the overflow of the beauty (Lakshmi) of Her face** (Vaktra-lakṣmī-parivāha).

verses.original:
नव॑-चम्पक॑ पुष्प-आभा॑ नासा-दण्ड॑ वि-राजि॑ता ।
तारा-का॑न्ति तिरस्करी॑ नासा-भर॑ण भासुरा॑ ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration: Nava-chanpaka pushpabha nasa-danda virajita Tarakanti tiraskari nasa-bharana bhasura

translations.english: She is **adorned with a nose-rod (Nāsa-daṇḍa) that shines like a fresh Campaka flower** (Nava-campaka-puṣpābhā-virājitā). Her **nose-ornament (Nāsa-bharaṇa) shines so brightly it puts to shame the splendor of the stars** (Tārākānti-tiraskārī-bhāsurā).

verses.original:
कद॑म्ब मञ्ज॑री क्लृप्त॑ कर्ण-पूर॑ मनो-हरा॑ ।
ताट॑ङ्क यु॑गळी-भूता॑ तप॑न-ओडु॑प मण्डला॑ ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration: Kadanba manjari klupta karna-pura mano-hara Tatanka yugali-bhuta tapa-nodupa mandala

translations.english: She is **charming (manoharā) with ear-ornaments (Karṇa-pūra) fashioned from Kadamba flower clusters** (Kadamba-mañjarī-kluptā). Her **earrings (Tāṭanka) have become the Sun and the Moon (Tapan-oḍupa-maṇḍalā)**.

verses.original:
पद्म॑-राग॑ शिळा-दर्श॑ परि-भावि॑ कपोल-भूः ।
नव॑-विद्रु॑म बिम्ब-श्री॑ न्यक्-कारि॑ रद-नछदा॑ ॥ ९॥
verses.transliteration: Padma-raga shila-darsha pari-bhavi kapolabhuh Nava-vidruma binbashree nyakkari radanachada

translations.english: Her **cheeks (Kapola-bhūḥ) outshine the mirror-like surface of a Padma-rāga ruby** (Padmarāga-śilā-darśa-paribhāvi). Her **lips (Rada-nachadā) scorn the beauty of fresh coral and the Bimba fruit** (Nava-vidruma-bimba-śrī-nyakkārī).

verses.original:
शुद्ध॑-विद्या॑-अङ्कुर-आकारा॑ द्विजा॑-पङ्क्ति॑ द्वय-उज्ज्वला॑ ।
कर्पूर॑-वीटि॑का-मोद॑ सम-आक॑र्ष दिग्-अन्तरा॑ ॥ १०॥
verses.transliteration: Shudha vidyankurakara dvijapankti dvayojvala Karpura-vitikamoda samakarsha digantara

translations.english: She **shines with two rows of teeth (Dvija-paṅkti) that resemble the sprout of Śuddha Vidyā (Śrī Vidyā Mantra)** (Śuddha-vidyāṅkurākārā). The **fragrance of the betel-roll with camphor (Karpūra-vīṭikā-moda) she chews draws in all directions** (Samākarṣa-digantarā).

verses.original:
निज॑-संळाप॑ माधुर्य॑ विनि॑र्-भर्त्सि॑त कछपी॑ ।
मन्द॑-स्मित॑ प्रभा-पूर॑ मज्ज॑त्-काम-ईश॑ मानसा॑ ॥ ११॥
verses.transliteration: Nijasanlapa madhurya vinirbhastitakachapi Mandasmita prabhapura majatkamesha manasa

translations.english: The **sweetness of Her casual talk (Nija-saṁlāpa-mādhurya) puts to shame the music of the Kacchapī Vīṇā** (of Saraswati) (Vinirbhartsita-Kacchapī). The **mind of Kameshvara (Śiva) is immersed in the flood of light from Her gentle smile** (Mandasmita-prabhāpūra-majjat-Kāmeśa-mānasā).

verses.original:
अन॑-आकलि॑त सद्-ऋश्य॑ चुबुक॑-श्री॑ वि-राजि॑ता ।
काम॑-ईश॑ बद्ध॑-माङ्गल्य॑ सूत्र-शो॑भित कण्ठ-धरा॑ ॥ १२॥
verses.transliteration: Anakalita sadrusya chubuka shree virajita Kamesha bada mangalya sutra-shobhita kandhara

translations.english: She **shines with a chin (Cubuka) of unparalleled beauty** (Anākalita-sadṛśya-śrī-virājitā). Her **neck (Kaṇṭhadharā) is adorned by the auspicious thread (Māṅgalya-sūtra) tied by Kameshvara** (Kāmeśa-baddha-māṅgalya-sūtra-śobhitā).

verses.original:
कन॑क-अङ्गद॑ केयूर॑ कम॑नीय भुज-अन्वि॑ता ।
रत्न॑-ग्रैवे॑य चिन्ताक॑ लोळा मुक्ता॑ फल-अन्वि॑ता ॥ १३॥
verses.transliteration: Kanakangada keyura kamaniya bhujanvita Ratnagrai-veya chintakalola mukta phalanvita

translations.english: She possesses **beautiful arms (bhujānvitā) adorned with golden armlets (Kanakāṅgada) and bracelets (Keyūra)**. She wears a **gem-studded necklace (Ratna-graiveya) with a moving pendant (Cintāka) and a string of pearls** (Lolā-muktā-phalānvitā).

verses.original:
काम॑-ईश्वर॑ प्रेम-रत्न॑ मणि॑ प्रति-पण-स्तनी॑ ।
नाभि॑-आळा-वाळ रोम॑-आळी॑ लता॑-फळ कुच-द्वयी॑ ॥ १४॥
verses.transliteration: Kameshvara prema-ratna mani prati-panastani Nabhyalavala romali lata phala kuchadvaei

translations.english: Her **breasts are jewels offered in exchange for Kameshvara's love** (Kāmeśvara-prema-ratna-maṇi-pratipaṇa-stanī). The **line of hair (Roma-āli) rising from Her navel (Nābhy-ālā-vāla) is the vine (Latā) bearing the two fruits that are Her breasts** (Kuca-dvayī).

verses.original:
लक्ष्य॑ रोम॑-लत-आभा॑र॑ समुन्नय॑ मध्यमा॑ ।
स्तन॑-भार॑ दळन्-मध्य॑ पट्ट-बन्ध॑-वळी-त्रया॑ ॥ १५॥
verses.transliteration: Lakshya romalata bharata samunneya madhyama Stana-bhara dalanmadhya patta-bandha-valitraya

translations.english: Her **waist is inferred (Samunneya-madhyamā) from the presence of the delicate hair-creeper** (Lakṣya-roma-latā-bhārā). Her **waist has three folds of skin (Vali-traya) that look like a girdle (Paṭṭa-bandha) worn to support the waist which seems to break under the weight of Her breasts** (Stana-bhāra-dalan-madhya).

verses.original:
अरु॑ण-अरु॑ण कौस्तुम्भ॑ वस्त्र॑ भास्व॑त्-कटि-तटी॑ ।
रत्न॑-किङ्कि॑णि-का-रम्य॑ रश॑ना-दाम॑ भूषिता॑ ॥ १६॥
verses.transliteration: Arunaruna kaostunbha vastra bhasvatkatitati Ratna kinkinikaramya rashanadama bhushita

translations.english: Her **waist (Kaṭi-taṭī) shines (bhāsvat) with garments (Vastra) of deep reddish-orange color** (Aruṇāruṇa-kaustumbha). She is **adorned with a girdle (Rasanā-dāma) charming with tiny bells (Kiṅkiṇī) made of gems** (Ratna-kiṅkiṇikā-ramyā-bhūṣitā).

verses.original:
काम॑-ईश॑-ज्ञ-अत सौभा॑ग्य मार्दव॑-ऊरु॑-द्वय-अन्वि॑ता ।
माणिक्य॑-मकु॑ट-आकार॑ जानु॑-द्वय॑ वि-राजि॑ता ॥ १७॥
verses.transliteration: Kamesha-gynata saobhagya marda-voru dvayanvita Manikya makuta kara janudvaya virajita

translations.english: She possesses **two soft thighs (Ūru-dvayānvitā) whose beauty is known only to Kameshvara** (Kāmeśajñāta-saubhāgya-mārdava). Her **two knees (Jānu-dvaya) shine like crowns made of Manīkya (ruby) gems** (Māṇikya-makuṭākārā-virājitā).

verses.original:
इन्द्र॑-गोप॑ परी-क्षि॑प्त स्मर-तू॑ण-आभ जङ्घि॑का ।
गूढ॑-गुल्फा॑ कूर्म॑-पृष्ठ॑-जैष्णु॑ प्र-पद॑-अन्वि॑ता ॥ १८॥
verses.transliteration: Endra-gopa parikshipta smaratunabha janghika Guda-gulpha kurma prushtajaeishnu prapadanvita

translations.english: Her **shanks (Jaṅghikā) resemble the quiver (Tūṇa) of the God of Love, covered with Indra-gopa insects (which are red and velvety)** (Indra-gopa-parikṣipta-smara-tūṇābhā). She has **concealed ankles (Gūḍha-gulphā)** and **upper-feet (Prapadānvitā) that excel the back of a tortoise** (Kūrma-pṛṣṭha-jaiṣṇu).

verses.original:
नख॑-अदि॑धिति सन्छन्न॑ सम॑ज-न तमो-गुणा॑ ।
पाद॑-द्वय॑ प्रभा-जाळ॑ पर-आकृत॑ सरो-रुहा॑ ॥ १९॥
verses.transliteration: Nakhadidhiti sanchanna samajana tamoguna Padadvaya prabhajala parakruta saroruha

translations.english: The **splendor of her toenails** (Nakhādidhiti-sañchanna) **removes the darkness of ignorance (Tamo-guṇa) from the people** (Samajana). The **light emanating from her two feet** (Pāda-dvaya-prabhā-jāla) **outshines the lotus** (Parākṛta-saroruhā).

verses.original:
शिञ्जा॑न म॑णि-मञ्जीर॑ मण्डि॑त श्री॑-पद-अम्बुजा॑ ।
मराळी॑ मन्द-गम॑ना म॑हा-ला॑वण्य-शेवधिः॑ ॥ २०॥
verses.transliteration: Shinjanamani mangira mandita shrepadanbuja Marali mandagamana maha-lavanya shevadhih

translations.english: Her **auspicious lotus-feet (Śrī-padāmbujā) are adorned (Maṇḍita) with anklets (Mañjīra) making tinkling sounds** (Śiñjāna-maṇi). She has the **slow, graceful gait of a swan (Marāḷī-manda-gamanā)**, and is a **storehouse of Supreme Beauty** (Mahā-lāvaṇya-śevadhiḥ).

verses.original:
सर्व॑-अरु॑णा नव॑-अङ्गी॑ सर्व॑-आभ॑रण-भूषिता॑ ।
शिव॑-काम॑-ईश्वर॑-अङ्क-स्था॑ शिव॑-स्व-अधीन॑ वल्लभा॑ ॥ २१॥
verses.transliteration: Sarvaruna navadyangi sarvabharana bhushita Shiva-kameshvarankasdha shiva svadhinavallabha

translations.english: She is **completely red (Sarvāruṇā)**, possesses **youthful, unblemished limbs** (Navāṅgī), and is **adorned with all ornaments** (Sarvābharaṇa-bhūṣitā). She **sits on the lap of Śiva-Kameśvara** (Śiva-Kāmeśvarāṅkasthā), and is the **beloved who has Śiva under Her control** (Śiva-svādhīna-vallabhā).

verses.original:
सुमे॑रु शृङ्ग॑-मध्य-स्था॑ श्री॑मन्-न॑गर ना-यिका॑ ।
चिन्ता॑-मणि॑ गृह-अन्तर्-स्था॑ पञ्च॑-ब्रह्म॑-आसन-आसिता॑ ॥ २२॥
verses.transliteration: Sumeru shrunga-madhyasdha shreemannagara naeika Chintamani gruhantahsdha pancha bramga sanasdita

translations.english: She **resides in the center of Mount Sumeru** (Sumeru-śṛṅga-madhyasthā), and is the **Queen of Śrī Nagara** (Śrīman-nagara-nāyikā). She is **seated within the Cinctāmaṇi Mansion** (Cintāmaṇi-gṛhāntarasthā), **sitting on a seat formed by the Five Brahmas** (Pañca-brahmāsana-āsinā).

verses.original:
महा॑-पद्म॑-अटवी-संस्था॑ कद॑म्ब वन॑-वासिनी॑ ।
सुधा॑-साग॑र मध्य-स्था॑ काम॑-अक्षी॑ काम-दा॑यिनी ॥ २३॥
verses.transliteration: Mahapadmatavi sansdha kadanba vanavasinee Sudha sagara madhyasdha kamakshi kamadaeinee

translations.english: She **resides in the forest of great lotuses** (Mahāpadmāṭavī-saṁsthā), and **dwells in the Kadamba forest** (Kadamba-vana-vāsinī). She is **located in the middle of the ocean of nectar (Sudhā-sāgara-madhyasthā)**, with **desirable eyes** (Kāmākṣī), and **grants all desires** (Kāma-dāyinī).

verses.original:
देव॑-ऋषि॑-गण सङ्घा-त॑ स्तूय॑मान-आत्म॑-वैभवा॑ ।
भण्ड॑-असुर॑ वध-उद्युक्त॑-शक्ति॑-सेना॑ समन्वि-ता ॥ २४॥
verses.transliteration: Devarshigana sanghata stuyamanatma-vaibhava Bhandasura vadhodyukta-shakti-sena samanvita

translations.english: Her **innate glory (Ātma-vaibhavā) is praised by multitudes of Devas and Ṛṣis** (Deva-ṛṣi-gaṇa-saṅghāta-stūyamānā). She is **accompanied by an army of Śakti-s prepared to slay the demon Bhaṇḍāsura** (Bhaṇḍāsura-vadhodyukta-śakti-senā-samanvitā).

verses.original:
सम्पत्-क॑री॑ समा-रूढा॑ सिन्धु॑र व्रज॑-सेविता॑ ।
अश्व॑-आरूढ॑-अधिष्ठित॑-अश्व॑ कोटि॑भिर्-आव॑-वृता॑ ॥ २५॥
verses.transliteration: Sanpatkari samaruda sindhura vrajasevita Asvarudadhishtitasva koti bhiravruta

translations.english: She is **mounted on Sampatkarī** (Her elephant mount), and is **served by herds of elephants** (Sindhura-vraja-sevitā). She is **surrounded by millions of horses** (Aśva-koṭibhir-āvṛtā), **ridden by Her commanders** (Aśvārūḍhādhiṣṭhita).

verses.original:
चक्र॑-राज॑ रथ-आरूढा॑ सर्व॑-आयुध॑ परि-ष्कृता॑ ।
गेय॑-चक्र॑ रथ-आरूढा॑ मन्त्रि॑णी॑ परि-सेविता॑ ॥ २६॥
verses.transliteration: Chakra-raja radharudha sarva-yudha parishkruta Geya-chakra radha-ruda mantrini parisevita

translations.english: She **rides the Ratha (Chariot) named Cakra-rāja** (Cakra-rāja-rathārūḍhā), **adorned with all weapons** (Sarvāyudha-pariṣkṛtā). She is **served by Mantriṇī (Śyāmalā) who rides the Ratha named Geya-cakra** (Geya-cakra-rathārūḍhā-Mantriṇī-parisevitā).

verses.original:
किरि॑-चक्र॑ रथ-आरूढा॑ दण्ड॑-नाथा॑ पुरस्-कृता॑ ।
ज्वाला॑-मालि॑नि-का-क्षिप्त॑ म॑ह्नि-प्रा॑कार मध्य-गा॑ ॥ २७॥
verses.transliteration: Kiri-chakra radha-rudha dandanadha puraskruta Jvalamalinikakshipta mahni prakara madhyaga

translations.english: She is **accompanied by Daṇḍanāthā (Vārāhī) who rides the Ratha named Kiri-cakra** (Kiri-cakra-rathārūḍhā-Daṇḍanāthā-puraskṛtā). She **resides in the center of the wall of fire (Vahni-prākāra) created by Jvālāmālinī** (Jvālāmālinikā-kṣipta-vahni-prākāra-madhyagā).

verses.original:
भण्ड॑-सैन्य॑ वध-उद्युक्त॑ शक्ति॑-विक्र॑म हर्षि॑ता ।
नित्य॑-परा॑क्रम-अटोप॑ निर-ईक्ष॑ण समुत्सुका॑ ॥ २८॥
verses.transliteration: Bhandasainya vadhodyukta shakti vikrama harshita Nitya parakra matopa nireekshana samutsaka

translations.english: She is **delighted by the mighty prowess of Her Śaktis** (Śakti-vikrama-harṣitā) who are **eager to destroy Bhaṇḍāsura's army** (Bhaṇḍa-sainya-vadhodyuktā). She is **eagerly watching the spectacle of the Nitya Devis' valor and might** (Nitya-parākramāṭopa-nirīkṣaṇa-samutsukā).

verses.original:
भण्ड॑-पुत्र॑ वध-उद्युक्त॑ बाळ॑-विक्र॑म नन्दि॑ता ।
मन्त्रि॑णी॑ विर॑चित॒-विष॑ङ्ग वध॑-तोषि॑ता ॥ २९॥
verses.transliteration: Bhanda-putra vadhodyukta balavikrama nandita Mantrinyanba virachita vishangavadhatoshita

translations.english: She is **rejoiced by the valorous act of Bālādevī, who is ready to kill the sons of Bhaṇḍa** (Bhaṇḍa-putra-vadhodyukta-Bāḷā-vikrama-nanditā). She is **pleased by the slaying of Viṣaṅga by the Mother Mantriṇī** (Mantriṇyambā-viracita-Viṣaṅga-vadha-toṣitā).

verses.original:
विशु॑क्र प्राण॑-हर॑ण वारा॑ही॑ वीर्य॑-नन्दि॑ता ।
काम॑-ईश्वर॑ मुख-आलो॑क कल्पि॑त श्री॑-गण-ईश्वरा॑ ॥ ३०॥
verses.transliteration: Vishukra pranaharana varahi viryanandita Kameshvara mukhaloka kalpita shreganeshvara

translations.english: She is **delighted by the valor of Vārāhī who took the life of Viśukra** (Viśukra-prāṇa-haraṇa-Vārāhī-vīrya-nanditā). She **created Śrī Gaṇeśvara (Gaṇeśa) merely by a glance at the face of Kāmeśvara** (Kāmeśvara-mukhāloka-kalpita-Śrī-Gaṇeśvarā).

verses.original:
महा॑-गण॑-ईश॑ निर्-भिन्न॑ विघ्र॑-यन्त्र॑ प्रहर्षि॑ता ।
भण्ड॑-असुर॑-इन्द्र॑ निर्-मुक्त॑ शस्त्र॑-प्रत्य्॑-अस्त्र व॑र्षिणी ॥ ३१॥
verses.transliteration: Maha-ganesha nirbhinna vighnayantra praharshita Bhanda-surendra nirmukta shastra pratyastra varshini

translations.english: She is **greatly pleased when Mahā Gaṇeśa destroyed the obstacle-creating Yantra** (Mahā-gaṇeśa-nirbhinna-vighna-yantra-praharṣitā). She **showers counter-weapons (Pratyastra) to nullify the weapons (Śastra) released by Bhaṇḍāsura** (Bhaṇḍāsura-indra-nirmukta-śastra-pratyastrā-varṣiṇī).

verses.original:
कर॑-अङ्गुळी॑ नख-उत्पन्न॑ नारायण॑ दश-आकृतिः॑ ।
महा॑-पाशुपत॑-अस्त्र-अग्नि॑ निर्-दग्ध॑-असुर सैनि॑का ॥ ३२॥
verses.transliteration: Karanguli nakhotpanna narayana dashakrutih Mahapashupatastragni nirdagdha surasainika

translations.english: From Her **fingernails (Kara-aṅgulī-nakha) arose the ten incarnations of Nārāyaṇa** (Nārāyaṇa-daśākṛtiḥ). She **burnt the armies of the Asuras** (Nirdagdhāsura-sainikā) **with the fire of the Mahā-Pāśupata missile** (Mahā-pāśupatāstrāgni).

verses.original:
काम॑-ईश्वर॑-अस्त्र॑ निर्-दग्ध॑ स-भण्ड॑-असुर-शून्या॑का ।
ब्रह्म॑-इन्द्र॑-उप-इन्द्र॑ म॑हेन्द्र॑-आदि॑-देव॑-संस्तु॑त-वैभवा॑ ॥ ३३॥
verses.transliteration: Kameshvarastra nirdagda sabhandasura shunyaka Bramhependra mahendradi devasansthuta vaibhava

translations.english: She **destroyed Bhaṇḍāsura and his abode (Śūnyaka) with the missile (Astra) of Kāmeśvara** (Kāmeśvarāstra-nirdagdha-sa-Bhaṇḍāsura-Śūnyakā). Her **glory (Vaibhavā) is praised by Brahmā, Upendra (Viṣṇu), Mahendra (Indra), and other Devas** (Bramhendropendra-Mahendrādideva-saṁstuta).

verses.original:
हर॑-ने॑त्र-अग्नि॑ सन्दग्ध॑-काम॑-संजीव॑न-ओषधिः॑ ।
श्री॑मद्-वाग्-भव॑-कूट॑-एक॑ स्वरूप॑ मुख-पङ्कजा॑ ॥ ३४॥
verses.transliteration: Haranetragni sandagdakama sanjivanaoshadhih Shreemadvagbhavakutaika svarupa mukhapankaja

translations.english: She is the **reviving herb (Sañjīvana-auṣadhiḥ) for Kāma (Manmatha) who was burnt by the fire from Shiva's eye** (Hara-netrāgni-sandagdha). Her **lotus-face is the sole form of the sacred Śrīmad-Vāgbhava-Kūṭa** (Śrīmad-vāgbhava-kūṭaika-svarūpa-mukha-paṅkajā).

verses.original:
कण्ठ॑-अधः॑-कटि॑ पर्यन्त॑ मध्य॑-कूट॑-स्वरूपिणी॑ ।
शक्ति॑-कूट॑-एक॑-तापन्न॑-कटि॑-अधः॑-भाग॑ धारि-णी॑ ॥ ३५॥
verses.transliteration: Kantadhah-kati paryanta madhyakuta svarupinee Shakti-kutaikatapanna katyadhobhaga dharinee

translations.english: Her **form from the neck to the hip (Kaṇṭhādhaḥ-kaṭi-paryanta) is the essence of the Madhyakūṭa** (Madhyakūṭa-svarūpiṇī). She **embodies the Śaktikūṭa from the hip downwards** (Śakti-kūṭaika-tāpanna-kaṭy-adhaḥ-bhāga-dhāriṇī).

verses.original: मूल॑-मन्त्र॑-आत्मिका॑ मूल॑-कूट॑-त्रय॑-कळे-बरा॑ ॥ ३६॥
verses.transliteration: Mulamantratmika mulakutatraya kalebara

translations.english: She is the **soul of the Mūlamantra (Root Mantra - Śrī Vidyā)** (Mūlamantrātmikā), and Her **body (Kalebarā) consists of the three primary Kūṭas** (Mūlakūṭa-traya).

verses.original: कुळ॑-अमृत॑-एक॑-रसि॑का कुळ॑-सङ्केत॑-पाळि॑नी ॥ ३७॥
verses.transliteration: Kulamrutaikarasika kulasanketapaline

translations.english: She **delights in the nectar of the Kula path** (Kulāmṛtaika-rasikā), and is the **protector of the secret symbols (Saṅketa) of the Kula path** (Kula-saṅketa-pāliṇī).

verses.original:
कुळ॑-अङ्ग॑ना कुळ-अन्तर्-स्था॑ कौळि॑नी कुळ-योगि॑नी ।
अ-कुळ॑ स॑मय-अन्तर्-स्था॑ सम॑य-आचार॑ तत्-परा॑ ।
मूल॑-आधार॑-एक॑-निलया॑ ब्रह्म॑-ग्रन्थि॑ वि-भेदि॑नी ।
मणि॑-पूर॑-अन्तर्-उदिता॑ विष्णु॑-ग्रन्थि॑ वि-भेदि॑नी ।
आज्ञा॑-चक्र॑-अन्तर-आळस्था॑ रुद्र॑-ग्रन्थि॑ वि-भेदि॑नी ॥ ३८॥
verses.transliteration: Kulangana lulantasdha kaolinee kulayogini Akula samayantasdha samayachara tatpara Muladharaika nilaya bramhagrandhi vibhedini Manipurantarudita vishnugrandhi vibhedine Aagyna-chakrantaralasdha rudra-grandhi vibhedini

translations.english: She is the **Kula woman** (Kulāṅganā), **residing within the Kula** (Kulāntarasthā), the **Kāulinī** (Kaulinī), the **Kula-Yoginī** (Kula-yoginī). She **resides within the Ākula (the limitless space)** (Akula-samayāntarasthā), and is **devoted to the Samayācāra (the orthodox path)** (Samayācāra-tatparā). She **dwells solely in the Mūlādhāra cakra** (Mūlādhāraika-nilayā), **breaking the knot of Brahmā (Brahmā-granthi-vibhedinī)**. She **rises in the Maṇipūra cakra, breaking the knot of Viṣṇu** (Viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī). She is **situated in the center of the Ājñā cakra, breaking the knot of Rudra** (Rudra-granthi-vibhedinī).

verses.original: सहस्र॑-आरा॑-अम्बुज-आरूढा॑ सुधा॑-सार॑-अभि-व॑र्षिणी ॥ ३९॥
verses.transliteration: Sahasraranbujaruda sudhasarabhivarshinee

translations.english: She is **mounted on the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra-ambujārūḍhā)** and **showers the essence of nectar (Sudhā-sārābhi-varṣiṇī)**.

verses.original:
तत्-इल्-ल॑ता॑ सम॑-रुचि॑ष्-षट्-चक्र॑-उपरि॑-संस्थि॑ता ।
महा॑-शक्ति॑ कुण्डळि॑नी बिस॑-तन्तु॑ तनीयसी॑ ॥ ४०॥
verses.transliteration: Tatillata samaruchi shatchakropari sansdhita Mahashakti-kundalini bisatantu taniyasi

translations.english: She has the **splendor of a flash of lightning** (Tatillatā-samaruciḥ), and is **situated above the six Cakra-s** (Ṣaṭ-cakropari-saṁsthitā). She is the **Great Śakti Kundalinī, who is finer than a lotus fiber** (Bisa-tantu-tanīyasī).

verses.original:
भवा॑नी भाव॑ना-गम्या॑ भव॑-अरण्य॑-कुठारि॑का ।
भद्र॑-प्रिया॑ भद्र॑-मूर्ति॑र्-भक्त॑-सौभा॑ग्य-दायिनी॑ ॥ ४१॥
verses.transliteration: Bhavani bhavanagamya bhavaranya kutarika Bhadrapriya bhadra-murti rbhakta-saobhagyadaeini

translations.english: She is **Bhavānī** (Bhavānī), **attainable through contemplation (Bhāvanā-gamyā)**, the **axe that cuts down the forest of worldly existence (Bhavāraṇya-kuṭhārikā)**. She **loves auspiciousness (Bhadra-priyā)**, is the **embodiment of auspiciousness (Bhadra-mūrtiḥ)**, and **bestows good fortune upon devotees** (Bhakta-saubhāgya-dāyinī).

verses.original:
भक्त॑-प्रिया॑ भक्त॑-गम्या॑ भक्ति॑-वश्या॑ भय॑-आपहा॑ ।
शां॑भवी॑ शारद॑-आराध्या॑ शर्वा॑णी शर्म॑-दायिनी॑ ॥ ४२॥
verses.transliteration: Bhakta-praya bhakta-gamya bhakti-vashya bhaya-paha Shanbhavi sharadaradhya sharvani sharmadaeini

translations.english: She is **dear to devotees (Bhakta-priyā)**, **attainable by devotees (Bhakta-gamyā)**, **conquered by devotion (Bhakti-vaśyā)**, and **dispels fear (Bhaya-āpahā)**. She is **Śāmbhavī**, **worshipped by the Goddess Śāradā (Saraswati)** (Śāradārādhyā), is **Śarvāṇī**, and **bestows happiness (Śarma-dāyinī)**.

verses.original:
शङ्क॑री॑ श्री॑-करी॑ साध्वी॑ शर॑त्-चन्द्र॑ निभ-आन॑ना ।
शतो॑-दरी॑ शान्ति॑-मती॑ निर॑-आधारा॑ निर॑-अञ्जना॑ ॥ ४३॥
verses.transliteration: Shankari shrikari sadhvi sarachandra nibhanana Shatodari shantimati niradhara niranjana

translations.english: She is **Śaṅkarī** (bestower of welfare), **Śrī-karī** (bestower of wealth), the **virtuous Sādhvī** (Sādhvī), with a **face like the autumn moon** (Śarac-candra-nibhānanā). She has a **slender waist (Śatodarī)**, is **full of peace (Śāntimatī)**, is **without support (Nirādhārā)**, and is **stainless (Nirañjanā)**.

verses.original:
निर्-ले॑पा॑ निर्म॑ला नित्या॑ निर॑-आकारा॑ निर॑-आकुला॑ ।
निर्-गु॑णा निष्क॑ळा शान्ता॑ निष्क॑मा निर॑-उपप्लवा॑ ॥ ४४॥
verses.transliteration: Nirlepa nirmala nitya nirakara nirakula Nirguna nishkala shanta nishkama nirupaplava

translations.english: She is **without taint (Nirlepā)**, **pure (Nirmalā)**, **eternal (Nityā)**, **formless (Nirākārā)**, and **undisturbed (Nirākulā)**. She is **without attributes (Nirguṇā)**, **partless (Niṣkalā)**, **peaceful (Śāntā)**, **without desire (Niṣkāmā)**, and **unassailable (Nirupaplavā)**.

verses.original:
नित्य॑-मुक्ता॑ निर्-विकारा॑ निस्-प्रप॑ञ्चा निर॑-आश्रया॑ ।
नित्य॑-शुद्धा॑ नित्य॑-बुद्धा॑ निर॑-वद्या॑ निर॑-अन्तरा॑ ॥ ४५॥
verses.transliteration: Nityamukta nirvikara nisprapancha nirashraya Nitya-shudha nitya-budha niravadya nirantara

translations.english: She is **eternally liberated (Nitya-muktā)**, **unchanging (Nirvikārā)**, **beyond the world (Nisprapañcā)**, and **without refuge (Nirāśrayā)**. She is **eternally pure (Nitya-śuddhā)**, **eternally aware (Nitya-buddhā)**, **blameless (Niravadyā)**, and **continuous (Nirantarā)**.

verses.original:
निष्-कार॑णा निष्क॑ळङ्का॑ निर॑-उपाधि॑र्-निर॑-ईश्वरा॑ ।
नी॑-रागा॑ राग॑-मथ॑नी॑ निर्म॑दा मद॑-नाशिनि॑ ॥ ४६॥
verses.transliteration: Nishkarana nishkalanka nirupadhirnirishvara Niraga ragamadhani nirmada madanashini

translations.english: She is **without cause (Niṣkāraṇā)**, **stainless (Niṣkalaṅkā)**, **without limitation (Nirupādhiḥ)**, and **without a superior Lord (Nirīśvarā)**. She is **without attachment (Nīrāgā)**, the **destroyer of attachment (Rāga-mathanī)**, **without pride (Nirmadā)**, and the **destroyer of pride** (Mada-nāśinī).

verses.original:
निश्-चि॑न्ता निर॑-अहङ्का॑रा निर॑-मोहा॑ मोह॑-नाशिनि॑ ।
निर्म॑मा म॑मता-हन्त्री॑ निष्पा॑पा पाप॑-नाशिनि॑ ।
निष्क्रोध॑-आ क्रो॑ध-शम॑नी॑ निर्-लोभा॑ लोभ॑-नाशिनि॑ ॥ ४७॥
verses.transliteration: Nishchinta nirahankara nirmoha mohanashinee Nirmama mamatahantri nishpapa papanashini Nishkrodha krodhashamani nirlobha lobhanashini

translations.english: She is **without worry (Niścintā)**, **without ego (Nirahaṅkārā)**, **without delusion (Nirmohā)**, and the **destroyer of delusion** (Moha-nāśinī). She is **without selfishness (Nirmamā)**, the **destroyer of possessiveness (Mamatā-hantrī)**, **without sin (Niṣpāpā)**, and the **destroyer of sin** (Pāpa-nāśinī). She is **without anger (Niṣkrodhā)**, the **pacifier of anger (Krodha-śamanī)**, **without greed (Nirlobhā)**, and the **destroyer of greed** (Lobha-nāśinī).

verses.original: निस्-सन्दे॑हा स॑न्देह-घ्नी॑ निर्-भावा॑ भाव॑-नाशिनि॑ ॥ ४८॥
verses.transliteration: Nisandhaya sanshayaghni nirbhava bhavanashini

translations.english: She is **without doubt (Nissandehā)**, the **slayer of doubt (Sandeha-ghnī)**, **without phenomenal existence (Nirbhāvā)**, and the **destroyer of worldly bondage** (Bhāva-nāśinī).

verses.original:
निर्-वि॑कल्पा निर॑-अबाधा॑ निर्-भेदा॑ भेद॑-नाशिनि॑ ।
निर्-नाशा॑ मृत्यु॑-मथ॑नी॑ निष्क्रिये॑-आ निष्प॑रि-ग्रहा॑ ॥ ४९॥
verses.transliteration: Nirvikalpanirabadha nirbheda bhedanashini Nirnasha mrutyumadhani nishkriya nishparigraha

translations.english: She is **without differentiation (Nirvikalpā)**, **unobstructed (Nirabādhā)**, **without distinction (Nirbhedā)**, and the **destroyer of distinction** (Bheda-nāśinī). She is **imperishable (Nirnāśā)**, the **churner of death (Mṛtyu-mathanī)**, **actionless (Niṣkriyā)**, and **possesses nothing** (Niṣparigrahā).

verses.original:
निस्-तुळा नी॑ल-चिकु॑रा निर॑-अपाय॑-आ निर॑-अत्यया॑ ।
दुर्-लभ॑-आ दुर्ग॑-मा दुर्गा॑ दुख॑-हन्त्री॑ सुख-प्रदा॑ ॥ ५०॥
verses.transliteration: Nistula nilachikura nirapaya niratyaya Durlabha durgama durga dukha-hantri sukhaprada

translations.english: She is **unequalled (Nistulā)**, with **dark blue hair (Nīla-cikurā)**, **undamaged (Nirapayā)**, and **free from accidents (Niratyayā)**. She is **difficult to attain (Durlabhā)**, **difficult to approach (Durgamā)**, the **Goddess Durgā (Durgā)**, the **destroyer of sorrow (Duḥkha-hantrī)**, and the **bestower of happiness** (Sukha-pradā).

verses.original:
दुष्ट॑-दूरा॑ दुर्-आचार॑-शम॑नी॑ दोष॑-वर्जिता॑ ।
सर्व॑-ज्ञ-आ सान्द्र॑-करु॑णा सम॑-अधि॑का व॑र्जिता॑ ॥ ५१॥
verses.transliteration: Dushta-dura duracharashamani doshavarjita Sarvagyna sandrakaruna samanadhika varjita

translations.english: She is **far from the wicked (Duṣṭa-dūrā)**, the **pacifier of evil conduct (Durācāra-śamanī)**, and **free from all faults (Doṣa-varjitā)**. She is **Omniscient (Sarva-jñā)**, **full of deep compassion (Sāndra-karuṇā)**, and **none is equal to or greater than Her** (Samādhika-varjitā).

verses.original:
सर्व॑-शक्ति॑-मयी॑ सर्व॑-मङ्गळा॑ सद्-ग॑ति-प्रदा॑ ।
सर्व॑-ईश्वरी॑ सर्व॑-मयी॑ सर्व॑-मन्त्र॑-स्वरूपिणी॑ ॥ ५२॥
verses.transliteration: Sarva-shaktimaei sarvamangala sadgatiprada Sarveshvari sarvamaei sarvamantrasvarupini

translations.english: She is **full of all powers (Sarva-śakti-mayī)**, **all-auspicious (Sarva-maṅgalā)**, and **bestows the right path** (Sadgati-pradā). She is the **Goddess of all (Sarveśvarī)**, **pervading everything (Sarva-mayī)**, and the **embodiment of all Mantras** (Sarva-mantra-svarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
सर्व॑-यन्त्र॑-आत्मिका॑ सर्व॑-तन्त्र॑-रूपा॑ मन॑-उन्मनी॑ ।
मह॑-ईश्वरी॑ महा॑-देवी॑ महा॑-लक्ष्मी॑र्-मृद॑-प्रिया॑ ॥ ५३॥
verses.transliteration: Sarva-yantratmika sarvatantrarupa manonmani Mahishvari mahadivi mahalakshmi rmrudapriya

translations.english: She is the **soul of all Yantras (Sarva-yantrātmikā)**, the **form of all Tantras (Sarva-tantra-rūpā)**, and the **state of mindlessness (Manonmanī)**. She is **Māheśvarī** (the great Goddess), the **Great Deity (Mahādevī)**, **Mahālakṣmī**, and **dear to Mṛda (Śiva)** (Mṛda-priyā).

verses.original:
महा॑-रूपा॑ महा॑-पूज्या॑ महा॑-पातक॑-नाशिनि॑ ।
महा॑-माय॑-आ म॑हा-सत्त्वा॑ महा॑-शक्ति॑र्-महा॑-रतिः॑ ॥ ५४॥
verses.transliteration: Maharupa mahapujya mahapataka nashini Mahamaya magasatva mahashaktirmaharatih

translations.english: She has a **Great Form (Mahā-rūpā)**, is **greatly worshipped (Mahā-pūjyā)**, and the **destroyer of great sins** (Mahā-pātaka-nāśinī). She is **Mahāmāyā**, **of great purity/essence (Mahā-sattvā)**, the **Great Power (Mahā-śaktiḥ)**, and **Great Delight** (Mahā-ratiḥ).

verses.original:
महा॑-भोगा॑ मह॑-ऐश्वर्या॑ महा॑-वीर्या॑ महा॑-बळा ।
महा॑-बुद्धि॑र्-महा॑-सिद्धि॑र्-महा॑-योग॑-ईश्वर॑-ईश्वरी॑ ॥ ५५॥
verses.transliteration: Mahabhoga mahaishvarya mahavirya mahabala Maha-bhudirmahasirdhirmahayogeshvareshvari

translations.english: She is **Great Enjoyment (Mahā-bhogā)**, **Great Sovereignty (Mahā-aiśvaryā)**, **Great Valor (Mahā-vīryā)**, and **Great Strength** (Mahā-balā). She is **Great Intellect (Mahā-buddhiḥ)**, **Great Siddhi (Mahā-siddhiḥ)**, and the **Supreme Goddess of the Great Yogis** (Mahā-yoga-īśvareśvarī).

verses.original:
महा॑-तन्त्रा॑ महा॑-मन्त्रा॑ महा॑-यन्त्रा॑ महा॑-आसना॑ ।
महा॑-याग॑-क्रम॑-आराध्या॑ महा॑-भैरव॑-पूजिता॑ ॥ ५६॥
verses.transliteration: Mahatantra mahamantra mahayantra mahasana Mahayaga kramaradhya mahabhairava pujita

translations.english: She is the **Great Tantra (Mahā-tantrā)**, the **Great Mantra (Mahā-mantrā)**, the **Great Yantra (Mahā-yantrā)**, and the **Great Seat** (Mahāsanā). She is **worshipped according to the procedure of the Great Sacrifice (Mahā-yāga-kramārādhyā)**, and is **worshipped by Mahābhairava** (Mahābhairava-pūjitā).

verses.original:
मह॑-ईश्वर॑ महा॑-कळ्प॑ महा॑-ताण्डव॑-साक्षि॑णी ।
महा॑-काम॑-ईश॑-महिषी॑ महा॑-त्रिपुर॑-सुन्दरी॑ ॥ ५७॥
verses.transliteration: Maheshvara mahakalpa mahatandava sakshini Mahakamesha mahishi mahatripurasundari

translations.english: She is the **witness to the great cosmic dance (Mahā-tāṇḍava) of Maheśvara (Śiva) at the time of the Great Dissolution (Mahā-kalpa)**. She is the **Chief Queen of Mahā-Kāmeśa** (Mahā-Kāmeśa-mahiṣī), and the **Great Beauty of the Three Cities** (Mahā-Tripura-sundarī).

verses.original:
चतुष्-षष्ठ्य्॑-उप॑-चाराढ्य-आ चतुष्-षष्ठि॑-कळा-मयी॑ ।
महा॑-चतुष्-षष्टि॑-कोटि॑-योगि॑नी गण-सेविता॑ ॥ ५८॥
verses.transliteration: Chatushashtyupacharadya chatushashti kalamaei Mahachatushashtikoti yogini ganasevita

translations.english: She is **worshipped with sixty-four offerings (Upacārāḍhyā)** (Catuṣṣaṣṭy-upacārā), and is the **embodiment of the sixty-four arts** (Catuṣṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī). She is **served by millions of Yoginīs (Mahā-catuṣṣaṣṭi-koṭi-yoginī)**, numbering sixty-four times a crore (Mahā-catuṣṣaṣṭi-koṭi-gaṇa-sevitā).

verses.original:
मनु॑-विद्या॑ च॑न्द्र-विद्या॑ च॑न्द्र-मण्ड॑ल मध्य-गा॑ ।
चारु॑-रूपा॑ चारु॑-हासा॑ चारु॑-चन्द्र॑-कळा-धरा॑ ॥ ५९॥
verses.transliteration: Manuvidya chandra vidya chandramandala madhyaga Charu rupacharuhasa charuchandra kaladhara

translations.english: She is the **Manu-Vidyā** and the **Candra-Vidyā**, and **resides in the center of the Moon's orb** (Candra-maṇḍala-madhyagā). She has a **charming form (Cāru-rūpā)**, a **charming smile (Cāru-hāsā)**, and **wears the charming crescent moon** (Cāru-candra-kalā-dharā).

verses.original:
चर॑-अचर॑ जगन्-नाथा॑ चक्र॑-राज॑ नि-केत॑ना ।
पार्व॑ती पद्म॑-नयना॑ पद्म॑-राग॑ सम-प्रभा॑ ॥ ६०॥
verses.transliteration: Parvati padmanayana padmarga samaprabha

translations.english: She is the **Lord of the moving and non-moving world (Carācara-jagannāthā)**, and **resides in the king of Yantras, Śrī Cakra** (Cakra-rāja-niketanā). She is **Pārvatī**, with **eyes like a lotus (Padma-nayanā)**, and **shines like a Padma-rāga ruby** (Padma-rāga-samaprabhā).

verses.original:
पञ्च॑-प्रेत॑-आसना-आसीना॑ पञ्च॑-ब्रह्म॑-स्वरूपिणी॑ ।
चिन्म॑यी॑ पर॑-म-आन॑न्द॑ विज्ञा॑न-घ्न॑-रूपि॑णी ॥ ६१॥
verses.transliteration: Panchapretasanasina panchabramha svarupini Chinmaei paramananda vigynanaghanarupini

translations.english: She is **seated on a seat made of five corpses (Pañca-preta-āsanā)**, and is the **embodiment of the five Brahmas** (Pañca-brahma-svarūpiṇī). She is **Pure Consciousness (Cinmayī)**, **Supreme Bliss (Parama-ānandā)**, and the **form of the mass of spiritual knowledge** (Vijñānaghana-rūpiṇī).

verses.original:
ध्यान॑-ध्येतृ॑-ध्येय॑-रूपा॑ धर्म॑-अधर्म॑ वि-वर्जिता॑ ।
विश्व॑-रूपा॑ जाग्रि॑णी स्वप॑न्ती तैजस॑-आत्मिका॑ ॥ ६२॥
verses.transliteration: Dhyanadhyatru dhyeyarupa dharmadharma vivarjita Vishvarupa jagarini svapanti taijasatmika

translations.english: She is the **form of the meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation** (Dhyāna-dhyātṛ-dhyeya-rūpā), and is **free from virtue and vice** (Dharmādharma-vivarjitā). She is the **Universal Form (Viśva-rūpā)** in the **waking state (Jāgriṇī)**, and the **Taijasa-ātmakā (residing in the light of the subtle body)** in the **dreaming state (Svapantī)**.

verses.original:
सुप्ता॑ प्राज्ञ॑-आत्मिका॑ तुर्या॑ सर्व॑-अव॑स्था वि-वर्जिता॑ ।
सृष्टि॑-कर्त्री॑ ब्रह्म॑-रूपा॑ गोप्तृ॑-गोवि॑न्द-रूपिणी॑ ॥ ६३॥
verses.transliteration: Supta pragynatmika turya sarvavasdhavivarjita Prushtikartri bramharupa goptri govindarupini

translations.english: She is the **Prājña-ātmakā (residing in the causal body)** in the **deep sleep state (Suptā)**, and the **Turya (the fourth, transcendental state)**, which is **free from all states (Sarvāvasthā-vivarjitā)**. She is the **creator (Sṛṣṭi-kartrī)** in the **form of Brahmā (Brahma-rūpā)**, and the **preserver (Goptṛ) in the form of Govinda (Viṣṇu)** (Govinda-rūpiṇī).

verses.original:
संहा॑रिणी॑ रुद्र॑-रूपा॑ तिरो॑धान-कर॑-ईश्वरी॑ ।
सदा॑-शिव॑-अनु॑ग्रह-दा॑ पञ्च॑-कृत्य॑-परायणा॑ ॥ ६४॥
verses.transliteration: Sanharini rudrarupa tirodhanakarishvari Sadashivanugrahada panchakrutya parayana

translations.english: She is the **destroyer (Saṁhāriṇī) in the form of Rudra** (Rudra-rūpā), the **goddess who causes disappearance (Tirodhāna-karīśvarī)**. She **bestows grace (Anugraha-dā) in the form of Sadāśiva**, and is **devoted to the five cosmic functions** (Pañca-kṛtya-parāyaṇā).

verses.original:
भानु॑-मण्ड॑ल मध्य-स्था॑ भैर॑वी भ॑ग-मालिनी॑ ।
पद्म॑-आसना॑ भग॑वती पद्म॑-नाभ॑ सह॑-ओदरी॑ ॥ ६५॥
verses.transliteration: Bhanumandala madhyasdha bhairavi bhagamalini Padmasana bhagavati padmanabha sahedari

translations.english: She is **situated in the center of the Sun's orb** (Bhānu-maṇḍala-madhyasthā), is **Bhairavī**, and **Bhagamālinī**. She is **seated on a lotus (Padmāsanā)**, the **Auspicious Goddess (Bhagavatī)**, and the **sister (Sahodarī) of Padmanābha (Viṣṇu)**.

verses.original:
उन्मेष॑ निमिष॑-उत्पन्न॑ वि॑पन्न॑ भुव॑न-आवळिः॑ ।
सहस्र॑-शीर्ष॑-वदना॑ सहस्र॑-अक्षी॑ सहस्र॑-पात् ॥ ६६॥
verses.transliteration: Unmesha nimishotpanna vipanna bhuvanavalih Sahasrashirshavadana sahasrakshi sahasrapat

translations.english: From the **opening and closing of Her eyes (Unmeṣa-nimeṣotpannā)**, the **series of worlds are created and destroyed** (Vipanna-bhuvanāvaliḥ). She has **a thousand heads and faces (Sahasra-śīrṣa-vadanā)**, a **thousand eyes (Sahasrākṣī)**, and **a thousand feet** (Sahasrapāt).

verses.original:
आ-ब्रह्म॑-कीट॑-जननी॑ वर्ण॑-आश्रम॑ वि-धायि॑नी ।
निज॑-आज्ञा॑-रूपा॑-निगमा॑ पुण्य॑-अपुण्य॑ फळ-प्रदा॑ ॥ ६७॥
verses.transliteration: Aabramhakitajanani varvashrama vidhaeini Nijagyna rupanigama punyapunya phalaprada

translations.english: She is the **mother of all beings, from Brahmā down to the smallest worm** (Ā-brahma-kīṭa-jananī), and the **ordainer of the castes and stages of life** (Varṇāśrama-vidhāyinī). The **Vedas (Nigamā) are Her own command (Nijājñā-rūpā)**, and She is the **bestower of the fruits of virtue and vice** (Puṇyāpuṇya-phala-pradā).

verses.original:
श्रुति॑-सीम॑-अन्त॑-सिरूरि॑-कृत॑-पद-अब्ज॑-धूळि॑का ।
सकळ॑-आगम॑-सन्दोह॑-शुक्ति॑-सम्पू॑ट मौक्तिका॑ ॥ ६८॥
verses.transliteration: Shruti simanta sirurikruta padabja dhulika Sakalagama sandoha shukti sanputa maoktika

translations.english: The **dust from Her lotus feet (Padābja-dhūlikā) is used as vermilion on the forehead (Śirūri-kṛta) by the Vedic scriptures (Śruti-sīmānta)**. She is the **pearl (Mauktikā) contained in the oyster shell (Śukti-sampuṭa) of the entirety of the Āgamas (scriptures)** (Sakalāgama-saṁdoha).

verses.original:
पुरु॑ष-अर्थ॑-प्रदा॑ पूर्णा॑ भोगि॑नी भुव॑न-ईश्वरी॑ ।
अम्बि॑का अना॑दि-निध॑ना परि॑-ब्रह्म॑-इन्द्र॑-सेविता॑ ॥ ६९॥
verses.transliteration: Purushardhaprada purna bhogini bhuvaneshvari Anbika nadi nidhana paribramhendra sevita

translations.english: She **bestows the aims of human life (Puruṣārtha-pradā)**, is **complete (Pūrṇā)**, the **Enjoyer (Bhoginī)**, and the **Goddess of the universe** (Bhuvan-eśvarī). She is **Ambikā (Mother)**, **without beginning or end (Anādi-nidhanā)**, and **served by Brahmā, Indra, and others** (Paribrahmendra-sevitā).

verses.transliteration: Narayani nadarupa namarupa vivarjita

translations.english: She is **Nārāyaṇī** (the power of Viṣṇu), the **form of sound (Nāda-rūpā)**, and is **free from name and form** (Nāma-rūpa-vivarjitā).

verses.original:
ह्रीं॑-कारी॑ ह्रीं॑-मती॑ हृद्या॑ हेय॑-उप॑-आदेय॑-वर्जिता॑ ।
राज॑-राज॑-अर्चि॑ता रा॑ज्ञी॑ राजी॑व-लोच॑ना ।
रञ्ज॑नी रम॑णी रस्या॑ रण॑-त्-किङ्कि॑णी मेखळा॑ ॥ ७१॥
verses.transliteration: Hrinkari hrimati hrudya heyopadeyavarjita Rajarajarchita ragyni rajivalochana Ranjani ramani rasya ranarkinkini mekhala

translations.english: She is the **essence of the Hrim Bīja Mantra (Hrīṁ-kārī)**, is **full of modesty (Hrīṁ-matī)**, is **pleasing to the heart (Hṛdyā)**, and is **free from the acceptable and the rejectable** (Heyopādeya-varjitā). She is **worshipped by the King of Kings (Rāja-rājārcitā)**, the **Queen (Rājñī)**, with **lotus-like eyes (Rājīva-locanā)**. She is **delightful (Raňjanī)**, **charming (Ramaṇī)**, **full of sentiment (Rasyā)**, and has a **girdle with tinkling bells** (Raṇat-kiṅkiṇī-mekhalā).

verses.original:
रम॑-आ राक॑-इन्दु॑-वदना॑ रति॑-रूपा॑ रति॑-प्रिया॑ ।
रक्ष॑-आ-करी॑ रक्ष॑स-घ्नी॑ रम॑-आ रम॑ण-लम्पटा॑ ॥ ७२॥
verses.transliteration: Rama rakenduvadana ratirupa ratipriya Rakshakari rakshasaghni rama ramanalanpata

translations.english: She is **Ramā (Lakshmi)**, with a **face like the full moon (Rākendu-vadanā)**, the **form of Rati (the wife of Kāma, Rati-rūpā)**, and **dear to Rati** (Rati-priyā). She is the **protector (Rakṣā-karī)**, the **slayer of Rākṣasas (demons) (Rākṣasa-ghnī)**, **Ramā (delightful)**, and **deeply attached to Her lover (Kameshvara)** (Ramaṇa-lampaṭā).

verses.original:
काम्या॑ काम॑-कळा-रूपा॑ कद॑म्ब कुसुम॑-प्रिया॑ ।
कल्या॑णी जगत्-कन्दा॑ करु॑णा-रस॑-सागरा॑ ॥ ७३॥
verses.transliteration: Kamya kamakalarupa kadanba kusumapriya Kalyani jagatikanda karunarasasagara

translations.english: She is **desirable (Kāmyā)**, the **form of the Art of Love (Kāmakalā-rūpā)**, and **fond of Kadamba flowers** (Kadamba-kusuma-priyā). She is **Auspicious (Kalyāṇī)**, the **root of the universe (Jagat-kandā)**, and an **ocean of the sentiment of compassion** (Karuṇā-rasa-sāgarā).

verses.original:
कळा॑-वती॑ कळा॑-आळापा॑ कान्ता॑ काद॑म्बरी॑-प्रिया॑ ।
वर॑-दा वा॑म-नय॑ना वारु॑णी-मद॑-विह्वाळा॑ ॥ ७४॥
verses.transliteration: Kalavati kalalapa kanta kadanbari priya Varada vamanayana varunimadavihvala

translations.english: She is the **Mistress of Arts (Kalā-vatī)**, whose **speech is artful (Kalālāpā)**, the **Beloved (Kāntā)**, and **fond of Kadamba-liquor (Kādambarī-priyā)**. She is the **Giver of boons (Vara-dā)**, with **beautiful eyes (Vāma-nayanā)**, and **intoxicated with the wine Vāruṇī** (Vāruṇī-mada-vihvaḷā).

verses.original:
विश्व॑-अधि॑का विदा॑-विद्या॑ विन्ध्य॑-अचळ॑-निवासिनी॑ ।
वि-धात्री॑ विद्या॑-जननी॑ विष्णु॑-माय॑-आ विळासि॑नी ॥ ७५॥
verses.transliteration: Vishvadhika vidavidya vindhyachala nivasini Vidhatri vidajanani vishnu maya vilasini

translations.english: She is **superior to the universe (Viśvādhikā)**, **Knowledge and Ignorance (Vidā-Vidyā)**, and **resides in the Vindhya mountain** (Vindhyācala-nivāsinī). She is the **Creator (Vidhātrī)**, the **Mother of Knowledge (Vidyā-jananī)**, and the **playful power of Viṣṇu (Viṣṇu-māyā-vilāsinī)**.

verses.original:
क्षेत्र॑-स्वरूप॑-आ क्षेत्र॑-ईशी॑ क्षेत्र॑-क्षेत्रज्ञ॑-पाळि॑नी ।
क्षय॑-वृध्दि॑ वि-निर्मुक्त॑-आ क्षेत्र॑-पाळ॑-समर्-अर्चि॑ता ॥ ७६॥
verses.transliteration: Kshetra-svarupa kshetreshi kshetrakshetragynapalini Kshaya-vrudhi vinirmukta kshetrapala smarchita

translations.english: She is the **form of the Field (Kṣetra-svarūpā)**, the **Ruler of the Field (Kṣetreśī)**, and the **protector of the Field and the Knower of the Field** (Kṣetra-kṣetrajña-pāliṇī). She is **free from decay and growth (Kṣaya-vṛddhi-vinirmuktā)**, and is **worshipped by the guardian of the field (Kṣetrapāla)** (Kṣetrapāla-samarcitā).

verses.original:
विज॑या विम॑ला वन्द्या॑ म॑न्दार॑-जन॑-वत्सला॑ ।
वाग्-वादि॑नी वा॑म-केश॑ई वह्नि॑-मण्ड॑ल-वासिनी॑ ॥ ७७॥
verses.transliteration: Vijaya vimala vandya mandaru janavatsala Vagvadini vamakeshi vahni mandala vasini

translations.english: She is **Victorious (Vijayā)**, **pure (Vimalā)**, **venerable (Vandyā)**, and **affectionate to humble people** (Mandāra-jana-vatsalā). She is the **Goddess of Speech (Vāg-vādinī)**, **Vāmakeśī** (the ruling deity of the Vāma path), and **resides in the circle of fire** (Vahni-maṇḍala-vāsinī).

verses.original:
भक्ति॑-मत्-क॑ल्प-ळति॑का पाश॑-पाश॑ वि-मोच॑नी ।
सं-हृ॑त॑-अशेष॑-पाषण्ड॑ सद्-आचार॑-प्र-वर्ति॑का ॥ ७८॥
verses.transliteration: Bhaktimatkalpalatika pashupasha vimochani Sanhruta sheshapashanda sadachara pravartika

translations.english: She is the **wish-fulfilling creeper (Kalpa-latikā) for devotees** (Bhakti-mat), and the **liberator from the bonds of the material world (Pāśa-pāśa-vimocanī)**. She has **destroyed all heretics** (Saṁhṛtāśeṣa-pāṣaṇḍā), and is the **promoter of right conduct** (Sadācāra-pravartikā).

verses.original:
ताप॑-त्रय॑-अग्नि॑ सन्त॑प्त सम॑-आह्ळाद॑न च॑न्द्रि॑का ।
तरु॑णी त॑पस॑-आराध्या॑ तनु॑-मध्या॑ तम॑-अपहा॑ ॥ ७९॥
verses.transliteration: Tapatrayagni santapta samahladana chandrika Tatuni tapasaradhya tanumadhya tamo-paha

translations.english: She is the **moonlight (Candrikā) that greatly delights (Samāhlādana) those scorched by the three fires of suffering** (Tāpa-traya-agni-santapta). She is **ever-young (Taruṇī)**, **worshipped by ascetics (Tapasārādhyā)**, has a **slender waist (Tanu-madhyā)**, and is the **dispeller of darkness (Tamo-'pahā)**.

verses.original:
चिति॑स्-तत्-पद॑-लक्ष्य-अर्था॑ चित्-एक॑-रस॑-रूपिणी॑ ।
स्व-आन॑न्द॑-ळव॑-विभूता॑ ब्रह्म॑-आद्य॑-आन॑न्द-सन्त॑तिः ॥ ८०॥
verses.transliteration: Chiti statpadalakshyardha chidekarasa rupini Svatyanandalavibhuta bramhadyananda santitih

translations.english: She is **Consciousness (Citiḥ)**, the **indirect meaning (Lakṣya-arthā) of the word 'Tat' (That)** (Tat-pada), and the **form of the one essence of Consciousness** (Cideka-rasa-rūpiṇī). A **fragment of her own bliss (Sva-ānanda-lava-vibhūtā) forms the entire series of blisses starting with Brahma** (Brahmādyānanda-saṁtatiḥ).

verses.original:
परा॑ प्रत्यक्-चि॑ति-रूपा॑ पश्य॑न्ती प॑र-देवता॑ ।
मध्य॑मा वैख॑री-रूपा॑ भक्त॑-मानस॑-हंसि॑का ॥ ८१॥
verses.transliteration: Parapratyakchitirupa pashyanti paradevata Madhyama vaikharirupa bhaktamanasa hansika

translations.english: She is the **form of the transcendental and inward-facing Consciousness** (Parā-Pratyak-citi-rūpā), **Paśyantī**, and the **Supreme Deity (Paradevatā)**. She is the **form of Madhyamā and Vaikharī speech**, and the **swan dwelling in the mind of devotees** (Bhakta-mānasa-haṁsikā).

verses.original:
काम॑-ईश्वरी॑ प्राण॑-नाडी॑ कृत॑-ज्ञा काम॑-पूजिता॑ ।
शृङ्गा॑र-रस॑-सम्पू॑र्णा जळ॑-न्ध॑र-स्थिता॑ ॥ ८२॥
verses.transliteration: Kameshari prananadi krutagyna kamapujita Shrungararasa sanpurna jaya jalandharasdhita

translations.english: She is the **life-force (Prāṇa-nāḍī) of Kāmeśvarī** (Kāmeśvarī), **grateful (Kṛtajñā)**, and **worshipped by Kāma (Manmatha)** (Kāma-pūjitā). She is **full of the flavor of Love (Śṛṅgāra-rasa-sampūrṇā)**, and **resides in the Jālandhara Pīṭha** (Jālandhara-sthitā).

verses.original:
ओड्या॑ण पीठ॑-निलया॑ बिन्दुरा॑-मण्ड॑ल-वासिनी॑ ।
रह॑-ओ याग॑-क्रम॑-आराध्या॑ रह॑स्-तर्प॑ण-तर्पि॑ता ॥ ८३॥
verses.transliteration: Odyana pita nilaya nindu mandala vasini Rahoyaga kramaradhya rahastarpana tarpata

translations.english: She **dwells in the Oḍyāṇa Pīṭha** (Oḍyāṇa-pīṭha-nilayā), and **resides in the circle of the Bindu (the central point of the Śrī Cakra)** (Bindu-maṇḍala-vāsinī). She is **worshipped by the procedure of the secret sacrifice (Raho-yāga-kramārādhyā)**, and **satisfied by the secret oblation** (Rahas-tarpaṇa-tarpitā).

verses.original:
सद्यः॑ प्र॑सादि॑नी विश्व॑-साक्षि॑णी साक्षि॑-वर्जिता॑ ।
षड॑-ङ्ग॑ देव॑ता युक्ता॑ षड्-गु॑ण्य॑-परि-पूरिता॑ ॥ ८४॥
verses.transliteration: Sadyah prasadini vishvasakshini sakshivarjita Shadanga devata yukta shadgunya paripurita

translations.english: She **grants grace immediately (Sadyaḥ-prasādinī)**, is the **witness of the universe (Viśva-sākṣiṇī)**, and is **without any other witness (Sākṣi-varjitā)**. She is **accompanied by the six subsidiary deities** (Ṣaḍaṅga-devatā-yuktā), and is **perfected by the six virtues** (Ṣaḍ-guṇya-paripūritā).

verses.original:
नित्य॑-क्लिन्ना॑ निर॑-उपमा॑ निर्-वाण॑-सुख॑-दायिनी॑ ।
नित्य॑-षोड॑शि-का-रूपा॑ श्री॑-कण्ठ॑-अर्ध॑-शरीरि॑णी ॥ ८५॥
verses.transliteration: Nityaklinna nirupama nirvana sukhadaeini Nitya shodashika rupa shree kantardha sharirini

translations.english: She is **eternally compassionate (Nitya-klinnā)**, **unequalled (Nirupamā)**, and **bestows the bliss of liberation (Nirvāṇa-sukha-dāyinī)**. She is the **form of the sixteen Nityā Devis** (Nitya-ṣoḍaśikā-rūpā), and **occupies half the body of Śrīkaṇṭha (Śiva)** (Śrīkaṇṭhārdha-śarīriṇī).

verses.original:
प्रभा॑-वती॑ प्रभा॑-रूपा॑ प्रसि॑द्धा पर॑म-ईश्वरी॑ ।
मूल॑-प्रकृति॑र्-अव्य॑क्ता व्यक्ता॑-अव्यक्त॑-स्वरूपिणी॑ ॥ ८६॥
verses.transliteration: Prabhavati prabha rupa prasidha parameshari Mulaprakruti ravyakta vyaktavyakta svarupini

translations.english: She is **effulgent (Prabhā-vatī)**, the **form of effulgence (Prabhā-rūpā)**, **renowned (Prasiddhā)**, and the **Supreme Goddess (Parameśvarī)**. She is the **Root Cause (Mūla-prakṛtiḥ)**, **unmanifest (Avyaktā)**, and the **form of the manifest and the unmanifest** (Vyaktāvyakta-svarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
व्यापि॑नी वि॑विद्य॑-आकारा॑ विद्या॑-अविद्या॑-स्वरूपिणी॑ ।
महा॑-काम॑-ईश॑-नय॑न कुमुद॑-आह्लाद॑ कौमुदी॑ ॥ ८७॥
verses.transliteration: Vyapini vividhakara vidya vidya svarupini Mahakameshanayana kumudahlada kaomudi

translations.english: She is **all-pervading (Vyāpinī)**, has **diverse forms (Vividhā-kārā)**, and is the **form of both Knowledge and Ignorance** (Vidyā-avidyā-svarūpiṇī). She is the **moonlight (Kaumudī) that delights the lilies (Kumuda) that are the eyes of Mahā-Kāmeśa** (Mahā-Kāmeśa-nayana-kumudāhlāda).

verses.original:
भक्त॑-हृद॑य-तम॑-ओ-भेद॑ भानु॑-मद्-भानु॑-सन्त॑तिः ।
शिव॑-दूती॑ शिव॑-आराध्या॑ शिव॑-मूर्ति॑श्-शिव॑-अङ्करी॑ ॥ ८८॥
verses.transliteration: Bhaktahardhatamobheda bhanumadbanu santatih Shivaduti shivaradhya shivamurtishivankari

translations.english: She is the **sun's rays (Bhānu-saṁtatiḥ) that dispel the darkness of the devotees' hearts** (Bhakta-hṛdaya-tamo-bheda). She is the **messenger of Śiva (Śiva-dūtī)**, **worshipped by Śiva (Śivārādhyā)**, the **embodiment of Śiva (Śiva-mūrtiḥ)**, and the **doer of auspiciousness** (Śivaṅkarī).

verses.original:
शिव॑-प्रिया॑ शिव॑-परा॑ शिष्ट॑-इष्टा॑ शिष्ट॑-पूजिता॑ ।
अप्र॑मेय॑-आ स्व॑-प्रकाशा॑ मन॑-ओ-वाच॑-अगोचरा॑ ॥ ८९॥
verses.transliteration: Shivapriya shivapara shishteshta shishta-pujita Aprameya svaprakasha manovachamagochara

translations.english: She is **dear to Śiva (Śiva-priyā)**, **devoted to Śiva (Śiva-parā)**, **desired by the virtuous (Śiṣṭeṣṭā)**, and **worshipped by the virtuous** (Śiṣṭa-pūjitā). She is **immeasurable (Aprameyā)**, **self-effulgent (Sva-prakāśā)**, and **beyond the reach of mind and speech** (Mano-vācām-agocarā).

verses.original:
चित्-श॑क्ति॑श्-चेत॑ना-रूपा॑ जड॑-शक्ति॑र्-जड॑-आत्मिका॑ ।
गाय॑त्री व्या॑हृति॑-सन्ध्या॑ द्विजा॑-बृन्द॑-निषेविता॑ ॥ ९०॥
verses.transliteration: Chichakti schetanarupa jadashakti jadatmika Gayatri vyahruti sandhya dvijabrunda nishemita

translations.english: She is the **power of Consciousness (Cit-śaktiḥ)**, the **form of awareness (Cetanā-rūpā)**, the **power of matter (Jaḍa-śaktiḥ)**, and the **soul of matter** (Jaḍātmikā). She is **Gāyatrī**, the **Vyahṛtis**, the **Sandhyā**, and is **served by the multitude of twice-born (Brāhmaṇas)** (Dvija-bṛnda-niṣevitā).

verses.original:
तत्त्व॑-आसना॑ तत्त्व॑-मयी॑ पञ्च॑-कोश॑-अन्तर-स्थिता॑ ।
निः-सीम॑-महि॑मा नित्या॑-यौव॑न मद॑-शाळिनी॑ ॥ ९१॥
verses.transliteration: Tatvasana tatvamaei panchakoshantarah sdhita Nisima mahima nitya-yaovana madashalini

translations.english: She has the **Truth as Her seat (Tattvāsanā)**, is **full of Truth (Tattva-mayī)**, and **resides within the five sheaths (Kośas)** (Pañca-kośāntarasthitā). Her **glory is limitless (Niḥsīma-mahimā)**, She is **eternally young (Nitya-yauvana)**, and **shines with intoxication** (Mada-śālinī).

verses.original:
मद॑-घूर्णित॑-रक्त-अक्षी॑ मद॑-पाट॑ल-गण्ड-भूः ।
चन्द॑न द्रव॑-दिग्धा॑-अङ्गी॑ चाम्पेय॑-कुसुम॑-प्रिया॑ ॥ ९२॥
verses.transliteration: Madagharnita raktakshi madapatala gandabhuh Chandana drava digdhangi champeya kusumapriya

translations.english: Her **red eyes (Raktākṣī) are whirling from intoxication** (Mada-ghūrṇita), and Her **cheeks are slightly red (Pāṭala) due to intoxication** (Mada-pāṭala-gaṇḍa-bhūḥ). Her **limbs are smeared with sandalwood paste (Candana-drava-digdhāṅgī)**, and She is **fond of Campaka flowers** (Cāmpeya-kusuma-priyā).

verses.original:
कुशळा॑ कोम॑ळ-आकारा॑ कुरु॑कुल्ला कुळ॑-ईश्वरी॑ ।
कुळ॑-कुण्ड॑-आळया॑ कौळ॑-मार्ग॑-तत्-पर॑-सेविता॑ ॥ ९३॥
verses.transliteration: Kushala komalakara kurukulla kuleshvari Kulakundalaya kaolamarga tatpara sevita

translations.english: She is **skillful (Kuśalā)**, has a **delicate form (Komala-ākārā)**, is **Kurukullā**, and the **Goddess of the Kula (Kuleśvarī)**. She **resides in the Kula-Kuṇḍa (the Mūlādhāra cakra)** (Kula-kuṇḍālayā), and is **served by those devoted to the Kaula path** (Kaula-mārga-tatpara-sevitā).

verses.original:
सुम॑रा-गणा॑-नाथ॑-अम्बा॑ तुष्टिः॑ पुष्टि॑र्-मति॑र्-धृतिः॑ ।
शान्ति॑स्-स्वस्ति॑-मती॑ कान्ति॑र्-नन्दि॑नी विघ्र॑-नाशिनि॑ ॥ ९४॥
verses.transliteration: Sumara gananadhanba tushtih pushtirmati dhrutih Shanti spastimati mantirnandini vignanashini

translations.english: She is the **Mother of Sumara-Gaṇanātha (Gaṇeśa)** (Sumara-gaṇanāthāmbā), **Contentment (Tuṣṭiḥ)**, **Nourishment (Puṣṭiḥ)**, **Intellect (Matiḥ)**, **Courage (Dhṛtiḥ)**. She is **Peace (Śāntiḥ)**, **Well-being (Svasti-matī)**, **Luminosity (Kāntiḥ)**, **Joyful (Nandinī)**, and the **destroyer of obstacles** (Vighna-nāśinī).

verses.original:
तेज॑-ओ-वती॑ त्रि-नयना॑ लोल॑-अक्षी॑ काम॑-रूपिणी॑ ।
माळि॑नी हं॑सिनी॑ माता॑ मळ॑य-अचळ॑-वासिनी॑ ॥ ९५॥
verses.transliteration: Tejovati trinayana lolakshi kamarupini Malini hansini mata malayachala vasini

translations.english: She is **resplendent (Tejo-vatī)**, has **three eyes (Tri-nayanā)**, has **rolling eyes (Lolākṣī)**, and can **assume any form at will (Kāma-rūpiṇī)**. She is **Mālinī**, **Haṁsinī** (like a swan), the **Mother (Mātā)**, and **resides on the Malaya mountain** (Malayācala-vāsinī).

verses.original:
सु-मुखी॑ नळि॑नी सु॑-भ्रूः शोभ॑ना सुर॑-नायिका॑ ।
काळ॑-कण्ठी॑ कान्ति॑-मती॑ क्षोभि॑णी सूक्ष्म॑-रूपिणी॑ ॥ ९६॥
verses.transliteration: Sumukhi nalini subhru shobhana suranaeika Karikanti kantimati kshobhini sukshmarupini

translations.english: She has a **beautiful face (Su-mukhī)**, is **like a lotus (Nalinī)**, has **beautiful eyebrows (Su-bhrūḥ)**, is **radiant (Śobhanā)**, and the **leader of the Devas (Sura-nāyikā)**. She has a **dark throat (Kāḷa-kaṇṭhī)** (like Śiva), is **lustrous (Kānti-matī)**, the **agitator (Kṣobhiṇī)**, and has a **subtle form** (Sūkṣma-rūpiṇī).

verses.original:
धरा॑-शुद्धा॑ तप॑-आराध्या॑ जग॑त्-द॑य॑-आ वि-वर्ति॑नी ।
मृत्यु॑-रूपा॑ महा॑-कळी॑ काम॑-संजीव॑नी-प्रिया॑ ॥ ९७॥
verses.transliteration: Dharashudha taparadhya jagadda-yavivartini Mrutyurupa mahakali kamasanjivani priya

translations.english: She is **pure earth (Dharā-śuddhā)**, **worshipped through penance (Tapārādhyā)**, and is the **cause of the expansion/existence of the universe** (Jagat-dayā-vivartinī). She is the **form of Death (Mṛtyu-rūpā)**, **Mahā-Kālī**, and **dear to the revitalized Kāma (Manmatha)** (Kāma-sañjīvanī-priyā).

verses.original:
वज्र॑-ईश्वरी॑ वह्नि॑-मती॑ सदा॑-दिप्ति॑-समान॑-आभा॑ ।
सिद्ध॑-विद्या॑ सिद्ध॑-माता॑ सिद्ध॑-विद्या॑-धर॑-ईश्वरी॑ ॥ ९८॥
verses.transliteration: Vajreshvari vahni mati sadadipti samanabha Sidha vidya sidha mata sidhavidhya dhareshvari

translations.english: She is **Vajreśvarī**, **full of fire (Vahni-matī)**, and has the **luster of eternal flame** (Sadā-dīpti-samānābhā). She is **Sidda-Vidyā**, the **mother of Siddhas (Sidda-mātā)**, and the **goddess of the Vidyādharas** (Siddha-vidyā-dhar-eśvarī).

verses.original:
लक्षी॑-आ-अळाक्षि॑त-योगि॑नी कोटि॑-ब्रह्म॑-अण्ड॑-ज॑ननी॑ ।
महा॑-काळ॑-समा-अराध्या॑ महा॑-त्रिपुर॑-सुन्दरी॑ ॥ ९९॥
verses.transliteration: Lakshyalakshita yogini kotibramhanda janani Mahakala samaradhya mahatripurasundari

translations.english: She is a **Yoginī who can be perceived or not perceived** (Lakṣyālakṣita-yoginī), the **mother of a billion universes** (Koṭi-brahmāṇḍa-jananī). She is **worshipped by Mahākāla** (Mahākāla-samārādhyā), and is **Mahā-Tripurasundarī**.

verses.original:
चतुः॑-षष्ट्य्॑-उप॑-चार-आढ्या॑ चतुः॑-षष्ट्य्॑-कला॑-मयी॑ ।
महा॑-चतुः॑-षष्टि॑-कोटि॑-योगि॑नी गण-सेविता॑ ॥ १००॥
verses.transliteration: Chatushashtyupacharadya chatushashti kalamayi Mahachatushashtikoti yogini ganasevita
